intro: Ipomopsis effusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. Ipomopsis effusa is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates and is adapted to dry, well-drained environments.
